result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Marie Mularkey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid within term of probation.  If not paid a civl judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community or Mayfair Mall.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

Defendant Ashley Marie Mularkey in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9
months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 27
days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Mayfair Mall. 

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court informed defendant he/she may petition court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and upon receipt of letter from probation agent.

Defendant Ashley Marie Mularkey in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA St. Junior).  Sidebar held.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley Marie Mularkey in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
